bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchinson to Philip Showalter Hench, November 30, 1939

div1.p: Hutchison thanks Hench for his monetary contribution to the college. He provides information on a bronze plaque in the lobby of the Lazear Building for large contributors. Hutchison describes further plans for Founder's Day.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchinson to Philip Showalter Hench, November 30, 1939

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
November 30, 1939

div1.p:
I hope you had a pleasant trip East and am sorry
that I missed you. I want to thank you especially for your
plan to give one hundred dollars to the Lazear Building.
This is mighty fine of you and I had no thought of your doing
it. I appreciate it more than I can say.

In telling you the following I am sincerely not
asking you to raise the amount. I think it is a swell gift.
I do think I ought to tell you, however, that in the main
lobby of the building will be a great bronze plate giving
the names of all who have given one hundred and fifty dollars
or more. The payment of this amount extending over a period
of three years. It may be that you would like to be on that
and permanently recorded there as having had a part in the
Lazear Building. Of course, I would like to have your name
there too. Please do not feel that you have to raise this.
If I thought it was important I would ask you to do so, but
it isn't. I just want you to know about it.

W C John hall - data on experiments knew all the
people involved
wasn't there at the time

We are going on with our plans for Founders' Day
and still studying the matter of a leading speaker. Three
suggestions have come to me which are impressive. One is
Doctor Leahy of Boston, the second Doctor Balfour of Mayos
and the third is Doctor Abel of Louisville. I would rather
not consider Doctor Balfour because of the fact that I hope
to have you taking a part in the program. When you have
your list of suggestions ready be sure to send it in to me
with any details possible.

good surgeon, proof good operation
“just a side down” - fled

Continue to work on the story of Lazear and his
assistants and get such pictures as you can. It seems to
me that we might very well combine this lecture with the
presentation of Yellow Jack.

Give my love to Mary. We hope all the family are
well.
div1.closer:
Affectionately yours, Hutch Doctor P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
